moves.5. Bd3 c5 6. c3 Be7: Normal is Nc6 I had the idea of Nf3 Qb6 O-O sacrificing the d4 pawn for a powerful initiative.  cxd4 cxd4 Nxd4 Nxd4 Qxd4 Nf3.
moves.7. Qg4: Beginning piece development to the king side.
moves.7... O-O 8. Ne2: Adding support to d4 and allowing the knight to come to f4.
moves.8... cxd4 9. cxd4 Nc6 10. O-O f5: !? better might have been f6 however this isn't a bad move seeing as white takes e.p. exf6 is bad for white.
moves.11. Qh5 Qe8: I don't want to trade queens since black is cramped and I have better attack chances.
moves.12. Qh3 Nb4 13. Bb1: Maintaining the bishops pressure on the diagonal.
moves.13... Nb6 14. a3: Kicking the knight back and freeing up my ls bishop.
moves.14... Nc6 15. Kh1: My plan is to play g4 at some point so I'm opening the g1 square for my rook.
moves.15... g6: ?! weakens blacks dark squares significantly around his king.
moves.16. Nf3 Qd8 17. Qh6: ?! This doesn't really do anything for white g4 I believe puts more pressure on blacks game.
moves.17... Rf7 18. Nf4: Creating the possibility of a knight sac on g6 and putting pressure on e6.
moves.18... Bf8 19. Qh3 Qc7: Trying to create queen side play.
moves.20. g4 Na5 21. Ng5: ! pressures e6 and defends against blacks threat of Nb3.
moves.22... Nac4: ? Nc6 was the move.  Bb4 is devastating.
moves.23. Bb4 Rg7: ?? loses big material Bxe8 is devastating to bad I missed it :(.
moves.24. Nfxe6: I saw the fork but missed that Bxf8 would put the king in the fork :/.
moves.24... Bxe6 25. Nxe6 Qd7 26. gxf5: I'm sure this was unexpected on my part but starts to open up blacks king side.  I'm not sure this is the best move but I felt Bxf8 Rxf8 Nxg7 Qxg7 and black is holding on.
moves.27. Bxe7: Black resigns.  fxg6 is going to be hard to deal with.
